name: Reduce complexity by symmetry.
Enumeration constants can be prefixed by a common type name.
goto should not be used.
do-while loops can be avoided.
Variables should be initialized where they are declared.
synonym: initialize variables where they are declared

name: Class and method header comments should follow the JavaDoc conventions.
Complex conditional expressions must be avoided. Introduce temporary boolean variables instead .
synonym: complex conditional expressions$conditional expressions are too complex

name: Methods should be separated by three blank lines.
Variables must never have dual meaning.
Executable statements in conditionals must be avoided.
Private class variables should have underscore suffix.
Colons should be surrounded by white space.
The incompleteness of split lines must be made obvious.
Commas should be followed by a white space.
Negated boolean variable names must be avoided.
Naming pointers specifically should be avoided.
Variables in declarations can be left aligned.
Generic variables should have the same name as their type.
Use alignment wherever it enhances readability.
File content must be kept within 80 columns.
Abbreviations in names should be avoided.
Use of global variables should be minimized use.
All definitions should reside in source files.
Include statements must be located at the top of a file only.
synonym: locate include statements at the top of a file

name: All names should be written in English.
Header files must contain an include guard.
synonym: include guard must in header files

name: Basic indentation should be 2.
The conditional should be put on a separate line.
Variable names must be in mixed case starting with lower case.
synonym: variable names must started with lower case

name: Variables should be declared in the smallest scope possible.
synonym: declare variables in the smallest scope possible$define variables in the smallest scope possible

name: Exception classes should be suffixed with Exception.
The prefix is should be used for boolean variables and methods.
synonym: name boolean variables and methods$boolean variables$boolean methods

name: Use//for all comments, including multi-line comments.
Type conversions must always be done explicitly. Never rely on implicit type conversion.
The use of magic numbers in the code should be avoided. Numbers other than 0 and 1 should be considered declared as named constants instead.
